steps.description: Annealing of 5-AGNR to induce lateral fusion into wider GNRs
Cover the GNRs with a poly(methyl methacrylate) (PMMA) film to supply mechanical support and protect the GNRs.
Detach the mica from the substrate in a bath of hydrofluoric acid (40 wt.%) solution.
Remove the gold below the GNRs by a commercial gold etchant (Sigma-Aldrich) and cleaned in ultra-pure water several times.
Transfer the GNR/PMMA film on the target device with the pre-fabricated graphene electrodes.
Remove the PMMA by hot acetone washing.
Anneal the graphene/GNRs devices in the probe-station.

synthesis.notes: By increasing the annealing temperature, 5-AGNR can undergo lateral fusion into wider GNRs. Fixing the annealing temperature at 600 °C, the resulting GNRs are a mixture of 10-AGNR and non-negligible amounts of 5-AGNR, 15-AGNR and 20-AGNR.

steps.description: 5-AGNR was prepared from 3,9 (10)-dibromoperylene (DBP) by setting the annealing temperature at 350 °C.

By increasing the annealing temperature, 5-AGNR can undergo lateral fusion into wider GNRs. Fixing the annealing temperature at 600 °C, the resulting GNRs are a mixture of 10-AGNR and non-negligible amounts of 5-AGNR, 15-AGNR and 20-AGNR

synthesis.notes: The sample labelled 5n-AGNR is a mixture containing mainly 10-AGNR and also some amounts of 5-, 15-, and 20-AGNRs.

The extraction accurately reflects the information presented in the source text.
